meanings.definition: The position of the body or the way in which someone holds themselves.
meanings.sent1: Her posture was straight and tall as she walked to the front of the class.
meanings.sent2: Good posture is important for maintaining a healthy spine.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the dog's posture, but ended up looking like a wobbly tower.
meanings.sent4: His posture exuded confidence, like a soldier standing at attention.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful posture captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: A particular way of dealing with or considering something; an approach or attitude.
meanings.sent1: His posture towards challenges was always one of determination and perseverance.
meanings.sent2: Having a positive posture towards life can lead to greater happiness.
meanings.sent3: The child's posture towards broccoli was one of extreme disgust.
meanings.sent4: Her posture towards learning was like a sponge, eager to absorb new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The company's posture towards innovation set them apart from their competitors.
